description:
A comparative language education approach to language policy & planning issues, especially those related to TESOL, with a focus on the Pacific basin. The development of standard languages & increasing access to languages of wider communication through increased educational provision has been a major driving force for modernisation & change in this region. A social, historical & educational examination of forces unleashed by language & education provision and how language planning is applied to new issues & problems is provided.

This course may not be offered if the enrolment is less than 10 students.
